title: I have a 17 year old that is planning to move out on her 18th birthday.
question: I have a 17 year old that is planning to move out on her 18th birthday. In california will I still be responsible for medical debt accrued post birthday?
answers:
Congratulations. These days most kid move back in instead of moving out.

You will not be responsible for her medical debts unless a court orders you to be. There are times when a parent is ordered by a court to provide the necessities of life for a severely disabled adult child, but that is rare, and would not happen where it imposes a serious financial hardship on the parent.
No, you will not be responsible unless you sign. A parent cannot be held liable for debts of their adult children, unless they are cosigners, co-borrowers, etc.
